review: I live in a rural area where DSL and cable are not available, so my "high speed" Internet is not that great.  I have tried to stream shows and movies with a smart tv and with an iPad, but my internet will not keep up with either because I cannot manually buffer.  With our Kindle Fire, though, I can pause the show for 3-5 minutes and can watch for at least an hour with decent quality and never have to rebuffer.  I was excited about the Fire Stick because I thought it would work the same way and that we could finally stream to our tv.  However, this does not seem to be the case because no matter how long we pause the show, it does not continue to download so we are in a constant state of rebuffering.  I am still working to try to figure it all out, but as of right now, I am very disappointed.My other complaint, which is also caused by our slow internet, is that the menus are slow to load, so if you are browsing for a show before it all loads it jumps back a level when more of the menu does load.Update:  It appears that the shows do continue to upload when paused, but the status bar does not indicate that this is happening.  Additionally, I cannot tell if it will continue to the end of the movie or if it will only go so long.  We kept one movie paused while we watched an entire DVD movie.  When we started back with the Fire Stick movie, it had to buffer about 20 minutes in but then showed the rest without rebuffering.  Not completely sure if it is our Fire Stick or our Internet.
author: Lance Boyer
